Name: Smart Storage Configuration Message Registry
Description: This registry defines Smart Storage Configuration messages

Success.Description: Indicates that all conditions of a successful operation have been met.

MalformedJSON.Description: Indicates that the request body was malformed JSON.  Could be duplicate, syntax error, etc.
MalformedJSON.Message: The request body submitted was malformed JSON and could not be parsed by the receiving service
MalformedJSON.Resolution: Ensure that the request body is valid JSON and resubmit the request.

InternalError.Description: Indicates that an internal error has occurred.

PropertyRequiresLogicalDrives.Description: Indicates that the value given for the property requires at least one configured logical drive.
PropertyRequiresLogicalDrives.Message: Setting property %1 requires at least one configured logical drive
PropertyRequiresLogicalDrives.Resolution: Configure at least one logical drive.

PropertyRequiresMixedModeSupport.Description: Indicates that the value given for the property requires mixed mode support on the controller.
PropertyRequiresMixedModeSupport.Message: Setting property %1 requires mixed mode support on the controller
PropertyRequiresMixedModeSupport.Resolution: Remove the property or attempt on a controller that supports mixed mode.

LogicalDrivesInPendingHBAMode.Description: Indicates that the logical drives are being requested and the controller is pending HBA mode.
LogicalDrivesInPendingHBAMode.Message: Cannot process request due to conflicting logical drives and controller pending HBA mode
LogicalDrivesInPendingHBAMode.Resolution: Change the controller mode or delete all logical drives.

LogicalDriveNotFound.Description: Indicates that the logical drive was not found.
LogicalDriveNotFound.Message: Logical drive with ID %1 not found

LogicalDriveNotFoundWarning.Description: Indicates that the logical drive was not found but is not required to complete the request.
LogicalDriveNotFoundWarning.Message: Logical drive with ID %1 not found

PhysicalDriveNotFound.Description: Indicates that the physical drive was not found.

PropertyValueEnumNotInList.Description: Indicates that the desired value is not in the enum list for the property.
PropertyValueEnumNotInList.Message: Property %1 does not have enum value %2
PropertyValueEnumNotInList.Resolution: Select a value for the property that is in the enum list.

PropertyKeyMissing.Description: Indicates that the request is missing a required property.
PropertyKeyMissing.Message: Property %1 is missing from the request
PropertyKeyMissing.Resolution: Add the missing property to the request.

PropertyValueOutOfRange.Description: Indicates that the property could not be set because the desired value is out of range.
PropertyValueOutOfRange.Message: Property %1 was given value %2 which is out of range for the property
PropertyValueOutOfRange.Resolution: Correct the value of the property.

PropertyValueTypeError.Description: Indicates that the property could not be set because the value type is incorrect.
PropertyValueTypeError.Message: Property %1 was given value %2 which does not match the correct type of the property
PropertyValueTypeError.Resolution: Correct the value of the property.

NoEditableConfigCreated.Description: Indicates that a configuration has not been created to edit.
NoEditableConfigCreated.Message: Internal error: no editable configuration has been created

CanCommitEditableConfigurationNoChangesT.Description: Indicates that the editable configuration was not committed because there are no editable changes to commit.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationNoChangesT.Message: Internal error: cannot commit the editable configuration because no changes were made

CanCommitEditableConfigurationUnlockedLo.Description: Indicates that the editable configuration was not committed because there are unlocked logical drives.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationUnlockedLo.Message: Internal error: cannot commit the editable configuration because unlocked logical drives exist

CanCommitEditableConfigurationOutOfSync.Description: Indicates that an external change occurred which invalidates the editable configuration.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationOutOfSync.Resolution: Recreate and re-submit the configuration request.

CanCommitEditableConfigurationInvalidSpa.Description: Indicates that the configuration's spare activation mode is not set to  "Predictive" while a spare drive is assigned to an Array with only RAID 0 logical drives.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationInvalidSpa.Resolution: Remove the spare drive from the conflicting Array(s) or set the spare activation mode to "Predictive".

CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Description: Indicates that the encryption configuration request is missing a key.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Message: Cannot commit the configuration because the encryption key is missing in the request
CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Resolution: Resubmit the request with an encryption key.

CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Description: Indicates that the encryption configuration request is missing a crypto officer password.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Message: Cannot commit the configuration because the encryption crypto officer password is missing in the request
CanCommitEditableConfigurationEncryption.Resolution: Resubmit the request with an encryption crypto officer password.

CanCommitEditableConfigurationPasswordRe.Description: Indicates that controller encryption credentials are required to complete the request.
CanCommitEditableConfigurationPasswordRe.Message: Controller encryption credentials are required to complete the request
CanCommitEditableConfigurationPasswordRe.Resolution: Provide the encryption username and password in the request.

CanCommitEditableConfigurationUnknownErr.Description: Indicates that an editable configuration cannot be committed for an unknown reason.

CommitEditableConfigurationFailed.Description: Indicates that the editable configuration was not committed because of an unknown reason.
CommitEditableConfigurationFailed.Message: Internal error: editable configuration not committed

CanCreateEditableConfigEditableConfigExi.Description: Indicates that an editable configuration was not created because an editable configuration already being edited.
CanCreateEditableConfigEditableConfigExi.Message: Internal error: cannot create an editable configuration because an editable configuration already exists

CanCreateEditableConfigInconsistentPortS.Description: Indicates that an editable configuration was not created because the controller's port settings do not match.
CanCreateEditableConfigInconsistentPortS.Message: Cannot create an editable configuration because the port modes on the controller are in a conflicting state
CanCreateEditableConfigInconsistentPortS.Resolution: Make the port settings consistent in the request and resubmit.

CanCreateEditableConfigControllerStatusN.Description: Indicates that an editable configuration was not created because the status of the controller is not in an OK state.
CanCreateEditableConfigControllerStatusN.Message: Cannot create an editable configuration because the controller status is not OK
CanCreateEditableConfigControllerStatusN.Resolution: Check status messages on the controller for more information.

CanCreateEditableConfigUnknownError.Description: Indicates that an editable configuration cannot be created for an unknown reason.

CreateEditableConfigFailed.Description: Indicates that the editable configuration was not created due to an unknown error.
CreateEditableConfigFailed.Message: Internal error: editable configuration not created due to an unknown error

ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedOperation.Description: Indicates that changing the controller mode is not supported on controller.
ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedOperation.Message: Changing the controller mode is not supported on this controller
ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedOperation.Resolution: Remove the controller mode property from the request.

ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedMode.Description: Indicates that the desired controller mode is invalid or unsupported.
ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedMode.Message: %1 is an invalid/unsupported value for the controller mode
ChangeControllerModeUnsupportedMode.Resolution: Correct the value of the controller mode.

ChangeControllerModeSelectedModePending.Description: Indicates that the desired controller mode is already pending a reboot.
ChangeControllerModeSelectedModePending.Message: The controller mode is already set to %1 and is pending a reboot
ChangeControllerModeSelectedModePending.Resolution: Reboot the system to apply the pending controller mode.

ChangeControllerModeLogicalDrivesExist.Description: Indicates that the controller mode cannot be changed because the controller has configured logical drives.
ChangeControllerModeLogicalDrivesExist.Message: The controller mode cannot be changed to %1 because the controller has configured logical drives

ChangeControllerModeEncryptionIsEnabled.Description: Indicates that the controller mode cannot be changed because encryption is enabled.
ChangeControllerModeEncryptionIsEnabled.Message: The controller mode cannot be changed to %1 because the controller has encryption enabled

ChangeControllerModeFailed.Description: Indicates that the controller was not changed to the desired mode due to an unknown error.
ChangeControllerModeFailed.Message: Internal error: not changed controller mode to %1 due to an unknown error

ChangeControllerModeUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the controller mode cannot be changed for an unknown reason.

ChangePowerModeUnsupportedMode.Description: Indicates that the desired power mode is invalid or unsupported.
ChangePowerModeUnsupportedMode.Message: %1 is an invalid/unsupported value for the power mode
ChangePowerModeUnsupportedMode.Resolution: Correct the value of the power mode.

ChangePowerModeSelectedModePending.Description: Indicates that the desired power mode is already pending a reboot.
ChangePowerModeSelectedModePending.Message: The power mode is already set to %1 and is pending a reboot
ChangePowerModeSelectedModePending.Resolution: Reboot the system to apply the pending power mode.

ChangePowerModeUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the power mode cannot be changed for an unknown reason.

ChangePowerModeFailed.Description: Indicates that the power mode was not changed to maximum due to an unknown error.
ChangePowerModeFailed.Message: Internal error: power mode not changed to %1 due to an unknown error

ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedOperation.Description: Indicates that changing the connector mode is not supported on the connector.
ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedOperation.Message: The connector mode for connector %1 cannot be changed because the connector does not support changing connector modes
ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedOperation.Resolution: Remove the connector mode property from the request.

ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedMode.Description: Indicates that the desired connector mode is invalid or unsupported.
ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedMode.Message: Connector %1 could not be set to %1 because it is an invalid/unsupported value
ChangeConnectorModeUnsupportedMode.Resolution: Correct the value of the connector mode.

ChangeConnectorModeSelectedModePending.Description: Indicates that the desired connector mode is already pending a reboot.
ChangeConnectorModeSelectedModePending.Message: Connector %1 is already set to %2 and is pending a reboot
ChangeConnectorModeSelectedModePending.Resolution: Reboot the system to apply the pending connector mode.

ChangeConnectorModeLogicalDrivesExist.Description: Indicates that the connector mode cannot be changed because the connector has configured logical drives.
ChangeConnectorModeLogicalDrivesExist.Message: Connector %1 cannot be changed to %2 because the connector has configured logical drives

ChangeConnectorModeFailed.Description: Indicates that the connector was not changed to the desired mode due to an unknown error.
ChangeConnectorModeFailed.Message: Internal error: not changed connector %1 to %2 mode due to an unknown error

ChangeConnectorModeConnectorNotFound.Description: Indicates that the connector mode was not changed because the connector was not found.
ChangeConnectorModeConnectorNotFound.Message: Internal error: connector mode not changed because connector at index %1 not found

ChangeConnectorModeUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the connector mode cannot be changed for an unknown reason.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set because the logical drive is locked.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is locked

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set because the logical drive is not assigned to an array.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is not assigned to an array
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Assign the logical drive to an array.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set because the logical drive has no RAID level set.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive has no RAID level set
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set the logical drive RAID level.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the controller does not support rapid parity initialization.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is not supported by the controller
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set a different logical drive initialization method for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that rapid parity initialization is not valid for the RAID level of the logical drive.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is not valid for the RAID level of the logical drive
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set a different logical drive initialization method for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the controller does not support over provisioning optimization.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is not supported by the controller
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set a different logical drive initialization method for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set for a non-SSD logical drive.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is not on an SSD array
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set a different logical drive initialization method for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set for the logical drive because the logical drive is not the first in the array.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is not the first logical drive in the array
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Resolution: Set a different logical drive initialization method for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive initialization method is not allowed at this time.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Internal error: setting the logical drive initialization method is not allowed for logical drive with ID "%1" at this time

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive initialization method is not allowed while it is part of an LU cache pair.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is configured with a cache logical drive

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive initialization method is not allowed for LU cache logical drives.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is a caching logical drive

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Description: Indicates that the logical drive initialization method cannot be set for the logical drive for an unknown reason.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveInitialization.Message: Initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2

SetEditableLogicalDriveInitializationMet.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive initialization method failed due to an unknown error.
SetEditableLogicalDriveInitializationMet.Message: Internal error: initialization method for logical drive with ID "%1" failed to be set to %2 due to an internal error

CanCreateEditableArrayMaxLDCountReached.Description: Indicates that the array cannot be created because the maximum number of logical drives on the controller has been reached.
CanCreateEditableArrayMaxLDCountReached.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the maximum number of logical drives on the controller has been reached
CanCreateEditableArrayMaxLDCountReached.Resolution: Delete one or more logical drive(s).

CanCreateEditableArrayNoUnassignedDrives.Description: Indicates that the array cannot be created because no unassigned drives are available.
CanCreateEditableArrayNoUnassignedDrives.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the controller has no unassigned drives available
CanCreateEditableArrayNoUnassignedDrives.Resolution: Delete an existing array or add more physical drives.

CanCreateEditableArrayCreatesNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that creating arrays is not allowed at this time.
CanCreateEditableArrayCreatesNotAllowed.Message: Internal error: cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because array creation is not allowed at this time

CanCreateEditableArrayUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the array cannot be created for an unknown reason.
CanCreateEditableArrayUnknownError.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1"

CreateEditableArrayFailed.Description: Indicates that the array was not created due to an unknown error.
CreateEditableArrayFailed.Message: Internal error: logical drive with ID "%1" not created due to an unknown error

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveMaxLDReache.Description: Indicates that the logical drive cannot be created because the maximum number of logical drives on the controller has been reached.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveMaxLDReache.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the maximum number of logical drives on the controller has been reached
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveMaxLDReache.Resolution: Delete on or more logical drive(s).

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveNoFreeSpace.Description: Indicates that the logical drive cannot be created because the array has no free space available.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveNoFreeSpace.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the array has no free space available
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveNoFreeSpace.Resolution: Delete one or more logical drive(s) from the array.

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that creating logical drives is not allowed at this time.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveNotAllowed.Message: Internal error: cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because logical drive creation is not allowed at this time

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerN.Description: Indicates that the logical drive cannot be created because the controller status is not OK.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerN.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the controller status is not OK
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerN.Resolution: Check status messages on the controller for more information.

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerE.Description: Indicates that the logical drive cannot be created because the controller is locked due to a missing controller password.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerE.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1" because the controller locked due to a missing controller password
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveControllerE.Resolution: Unlock the controller with the controller password and then resubmit the request.

CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveUnknownErro.Description: Indicates that the logical drive cannot be created for an unknown reason.
CanCreateEditableLogicalDriveUnknownErro.Message: Cannot create logical drive with ID "%1"

CreateEditableLogicalDriveFailed.Description: Indicates that the logical drive was not created due to an unknown error.
CreateEditableLogicalDriveFailed.Message: Internal error: logical drive with ID "%1" not created due to an unknown error

CanAddEditableDataDriveArrayContainsUnsa.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the array has unlocked logical drives.
CanAddEditableDataDriveArrayContainsUnsa.Message: Internal error: cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has unlocked logical drives

CanAddEditableDataDriveDriveIsNotUnassig.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the selected drive is not unassigned.
CanAddEditableDataDriveDriveIsNotUnassig.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not unassigned

CanAddEditableDataDriveCannotMixDriveTyp.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because its drive type does not match that of the array.
CanAddEditableDataDriveCannotMixDriveTyp.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because its drive type does not match that of the array

CanAddEditableDataDriveIncompatibleBlock.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because its block size is not compatible with that of the array.
CanAddEditableDataDriveIncompatibleBlock.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because its block size is not compatible with that of the array

CanAddEditableDataDriveMaxDataDriveCount.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the maximum number of physical drives on the array has been reached.
CanAddEditableDataDriveMaxDataDriveCount.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the maximum number of physical drives on the array has been reached
CanAddEditableDataDriveMaxDataDriveCount.Resolution: Remove one or more physical drive(s) from the array.

CanAddEditableDataDriveDriveIsNotConfigu.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the selected drive is not configurable.
CanAddEditableDataDriveDriveIsNotConfigu.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not configurable

CanAddEditableDataDriveNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that adding a data drive is not allowed at this time.
CanAddEditableDataDriveNotAllowed.Message: Internal error: cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not allowed at this time

CanAddEditableDataDriveUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array for an unknown reason.
CanAddEditableDataDriveUnknownError.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2"

AddEditableDataDriveFailed.Description: Indicates that the data drive was not added due to an unknown error.
AddEditableDataDriveFailed.Message: Internal error: data drive %1 not added to logical drive with ID "%2" due to an unknown error

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayStatus.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the array status is not OK.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayStatus.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array status is not OK
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayStatus.Resolution: Check status messages on the array for more information.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerC.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the controller cache status is not OK.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerC.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the controller cache status is not OK
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerC.Resolution: Check status messages on the controller cache for more information.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerS.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the controller status is not OK.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerS.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the controller status is not OK
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesControllerS.Resolution: Check status messages on the controller for more information.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsPred.Description: Indicates that the data drive cannot be added to the array because the drive is predicted to fail and the spare activation mode is set to 'predictive'.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsPred.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the drive is predicted to fail and the spare activation mode is set to 'predictive'
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsPred.Resolution: Select a different physical drive or set the spare activation mode to 'failure'.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveTooSma.Description: Indicates that the data drive's size is too small to be added to the array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveTooSma.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the drive size is too small

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesFullStripeS.Description: Indicates that the controller cannot support the full stripe size that would result from adding the data drive(s) to the array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesFullStripeS.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it would exceed the full stripe size supported by the controller
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesFullStripeS.Resolution: Reduce the number of added physical drives.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesHasUnsavedL.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the array already is queued to add new logical drives.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesHasUnsavedL.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has new logical drives queued to be created
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesHasUnsavedL.Resolution: Create the new logical drives first and then re-issue the request or re-issue the request without creating new logical drives on the array.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array they are attached to different port types.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is attached a different port type

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because it is not the required drive type for this array type.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not the required drive type for the array

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesInvalidDriv.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the new drive count would be invalid for the array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesInvalidDriv.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it would result in an invalid drive count for the array

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesLUCachingEn.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because LU caching is enabled.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesLUCachingEn.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" while logical drive cache is enabled

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesNotDataArra.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array which is not a data array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesNotDataArra.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array is not a data array

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesNotSupporte.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the controller does not support transformations.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesNotSupporte.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the required operation is not supported by the controller

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayContai.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the array has uncommitted logical drives.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayContai.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has uncommitted logical drives
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesArrayContai.Resolution: Resubmit the request after creating the logical drives.

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsNotU.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the drive is already configured or not available.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsNotU.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the physical drive is already configured

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesCannotMixDr.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the drive type is not compatible with the array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesCannotMixDr.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the drive type is not compatible with the array

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the drive block size is not compatible with the array.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesIncompatibl.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the drive block size is not compatible with the array

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesMaxDataDriv.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the array has the max supported configured drives.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesMaxDataDriv.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has the max supported configured drives

CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsNotC.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive(s) cannot be added to the array because the physical drive is not configurable.
CanAddEditableArrayDataDrivesDriveIsNotC.Message: Cannot add data drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the physical drive is not configurable

DataDriveNotFound.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive was not found.
DataDriveNotFound.Message: Data drive %1 for logical drive with ID "%2" was not found
DataDriveNotFound.Resolution: Modify the requested data drive list.

DataDriveSetNotFound.Description: Indicates that the requested data drive set was not found.
DataDriveSetNotFound.Message: Data drive set with desired parameters for logical drive with ID "%1" was not found
DataDriveSetNotFound.Resolution: Modify the requested data drive set.

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveDriveIsNotU.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the selected drive is not unassigned.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveDriveIsNotU.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not unassigned

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveDriveIsNotC.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the selected drive is not configurable.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveDriveIsNotC.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is not configurable

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveArrayHasNoD.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the array has no data drives assigned.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveArrayHasNoD.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has no data drives assign
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveArrayHasNoD.Resolution: Assign data drives to the array.

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveCannotMixDr.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because its drive type does not match that of the array.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveCannotMixDr.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because its drive type does not match that of the array

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveIncompatibl.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because its block size is not compatible with that of the array.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveIncompatibl.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because its block size is not compatible with that of the array

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveTooSmall.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the selected drive is too small.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveTooSmall.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because it is too small

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveMaxSpareDri.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the maximum number of spare drives has been reached.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveMaxSpareDri.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the maximum number of spare drives has been reached
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveMaxSpareDri.Resolution: Remove one or more spare drive(s).

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveNoSpareType.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the array has no spare type set.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveNoSpareType.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has no spare type set

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveInvalidSpar.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because the desired spare type is invalid.
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveInvalidSpar.Message: Cannot add spare drive %1 to logical drive with ID "%2" because the array has an invalid spare type
CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveInvalidSpar.Resolution: Correct the spare type of the array.

CanAddEditableArraySpareDriveInvalidSAM.Description: Indicates that the spare drive cannot be added to the array because spare activation mode must be set to predictive to assign spare drives to RAID 0 volumes.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelInvalidCh.Resolution: Remove invalid characters from the logical drive label.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelInvalidLa.Description: Indicates that the logical drive label cannot be set because the logical drive label is invalid.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelInvalidLa.Message: Label for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive label is invalid

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelInvalidLo.Description: Indicates that the logical drive label cannot be set because the target logical drive is invalid.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelInvalidLo.Message: Label for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the target logical drive is invalid

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelLabelTooL.Description: Indicates that the logical drive label cannot be set because the logical drive label is too long.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelLabelTooL.Message: Label for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive label is too long
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelLabelTooL.Resolution: Decrease the length of the logical drive label.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelNotAllowe.Description: Indicates that the logical drive label cannot be set because the target logical drive is a caching logical drive.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelNotAllowe.Message: Label for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the target logical drive is a caching logical drive

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveLabelUnknownEr.Description: Indicates that the logical drive label cannot be set for an unknown reason.

SetEditableLogicalDriveLabelFailed.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive label failed due to an unknown error.
SetEditableLogicalDriveLabelFailed.Message: Internal error: label for logical drive with ID "%1" failed to be set to %2 due to an internal error

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorLog.Description: Indicates that the logical drive accelerator cannot be set because the target logical drive does not exist.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorLog.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive does not exist

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNoA.Description: Indicates that the logical drive accelerator cannot be set because the logical drive is not assigned to an array.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNoA.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is not assigned to an array
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNoA.Resolution: Assign the logical drive to an array.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNot.Description: Indicates that the logical drive accelerator cannot be set because the logical drive is not the first logical drive of the array.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNot.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the logical drive is not the first logical drive of the array
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNot.Resolution: Delete the last logical drive in the array.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorUns.Description: Indicates that the logical drive accelerator cannot be set because the desired logical drive accelerator is unsupported.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorUns.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is not supported
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorUns.Resolution: Do not modify the logical drive accelerator.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Description: Indicates that IOBypass is already set as the logical drive accelerator.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is already set

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorDri.Description: Indicates that IOBypass is only supported on SSD arrays.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorDri.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is only supported on SSD arrays
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorDri.Resolution: Select a different logical drive accelerator for the logical drive.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorAlr.Description: Indicates that the desired logical drive accelerator is already set.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorAlr.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is already set

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNot.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator is not allowed at this time.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorNot.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is not allowed at this time

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator is not allowed because of a recovering/rebuilding logical drive.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the array has a rebuilding logical drive
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Resolution: Resubmit the request after the rebuild is complete.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator is not allowed because of a transforming logical drive.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the array has a transforming logical drive
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorArr.Resolution: Resubmit the request after the transformation is complete.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorLUC.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator is not allowed because the logical drive is configured for LU caching.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorLUC.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because it is being cached using a caching logical drive
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorLUC.Resolution: Remove the caching logical drive before setting the logical drive accelerator.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorBad.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator is not allowed because the cache backup power source is missing or charging.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorBad.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2 because the cache backup power source is missing or charging
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorBad.Resolution: Replace or charge the cache backup power source.

CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorUnk.Description: Indicates that the logical drive accelerator cannot be set for an unknown reason.
CanSetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorUnk.Message: Logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" cannot be set to %2

SetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorFailed.Description: Indicates that setting the logical drive accelerator failed due to an unknown error.
SetEditableLogicalDriveAcceleratorFailed.Message: Internal error: logical drive accelerator for logical drive with ID "%1" failed to be set to %2 due to an internal error

CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Description: Indicates that the desired controller survival mode is invalid.

CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Resolution: Do not modify the survival mode.

CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Description: Indicates that the controller survival mode cannot be set because the controller does not support survival mode configuration.
CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Message: Cannot set controller survival mode to %1 because survival mode configuration is not supported on the controller
CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Resolution: Do not modify the survival mode.

CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Description: Indicates that the controller survival mode cannot be set for an unknown reason.
CanChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPower.Message: Cannot set controller survival mode to %1

ChangeEditableControllerSurvivalPowerMod.Description: Indicates that the controller survival mode was not set due to an unknown error.

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTInvalidVa.Description: Indicates that the desired controller write cache bypass threshold is invalid.

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTInvalidVa.Resolution: Correct the write cache bypass threshold.

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTOperation.Description: Indicates that the controller write cache bypass threshold is not supported.
CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTOperation.Message: Cannot set controller write cache bypass threshold to %1 because it is not supported
CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTOperation.Resolution: Do not modify the write cache bypass threshold.

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTNoLogical.Description: Indicates that the controller write cache bypass threshold cannot be set because no logical drives are configured.
CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTNoLogical.Message: Cannot set controller write cache bypass threshold to %1 because no logical drives are configured

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTNoChange.Description: Indicates that desired write cache bypass threshold is already set.
CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTNoChange.Message: Cannot set controller write cache bypass threshold to %1 because it is already set

CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTUnknownEr.Description: Indicates that the controller write cache bypass threshold cannot be set for an unknown reason.
CanChangeEditableControllerWCBTUnknownEr.Message: Cannot set controller write cache bypass threshold to %1

ChangeEditableControllerWCBTFailed.Description: Indicates that the controller write cache bypass threshold was not set due to an unknown error.
ChangeEditableControllerWCBTFailed.Message: Internal error: controller write cache bypass threshold not set to %1 due to an unknown error

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeOpe.Resolution: Do not modify the controller boot volume.

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Resolution: Correct the target physical drive and resubmit

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Description: Indicates that the controller boot volume cannot be set because the target logical drive is invalid.
CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Message: Cannot set controller boot volume to %1 because the target logical drive is invalid
CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Resolution: Correct the target logical drive and resubmit

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Description: Indicates that the controller boot volume cannot be set because the target remote volume is invalid.
CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Message: Cannot set controller boot volume to %1 because the target remote volume is invalid
CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeInv.Resolution: Correct the target remote volume and resubmit

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeAlr.Description: Indicates that desired boot volume is already set.

CanChangeEditableControllerBootVolumeNot.Description: Indicates that setting the boot volume is not allowed at this time.

CanClearEditableControllerBootVolumeOper.Resolution: Do not clear the controller boot volume.

CanClearEditableControllerBootVolumeNotA.Description: Indicates that clearing the controller boot volume is not allowed at this time.
CanClearEditableControllerBootVolumeNotA.Message: Cannot clear controller %1 boot volume because it is not allowed at this time

CanClearEditableControllerBootVolumeUnkn.Description: Indicates that the controller boot volume cannot be cleared for an unknown reason.

ClearEditableControllerBootVolumeFailed.Description: Indicates that the controller boot volume was not cleared due to an unknown error.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionOpe.Description: Indicates that encryption is not supported on the controller.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionInv.Description: Indicates that the desired encryption configuration is invalid.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionNot.Description: Indicates that setting the encryption configuration is not allowed at this time.
CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionNot.Message: Cannot change encryption configuration to %1 because it is invalid

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionCle.Description: Indicates that setting/clearing the encryption configuration feature is not enabled on the controller.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionHas.Description: Indicates that setting/clearing the encryption configuration is unavailable while there are unlocked/committed logical drives.
CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionHas.Message: Cannot change encryption configuration to %1 because there are an unlocked/committed logical drives
CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionHas.Resolution: Resubmit the request without creating new logical drives or changing the encryption configuration.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionMan.Description: Indicates that the desired encryption key manager feature is not enabled on the controller.
CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionMan.Message: Cannot change encryption configuration to %1 because the feature is not enabled
CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionMan.Resolution: Select a different encryption key manager configuration.

CanChangeEditableControllerEncryptionUnk.Description: Indicates that the encryption configuration cannot be set for an unknown reason.

ChangeEditableControllerEncryptionFailed.Description: Indicates that the controller encryption configuration was not set due to an unknown error.

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Resolution: Do not attempt to clear the controller configuration metadata from the physical drive.

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCME.Description: Indicates that the controller configuration metadata on the physical drive cannot be cleared because encryption is enabled.
ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCME.Message: Cannot clear controller configuration metadata from physical drives because the controller has encryption enabled

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Description: Indicates that the controller configuration metadata on physical drives cannot be cleared because the controller has no physical drives attached.
ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Message: Cannot clear controller configuration metadata from physical drives because the controller has no physical drives attached

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Description: Indicates that the controller configuration metadata on physical drives cannot be cleared because no physical drives drives contain configuration metadata.
ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Message: Cannot clear controller configuration metadata from physical drives because no physical drives contain configuration metadata

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Description: Indicates that clearing the controller configuration metadata on physical drives is not allowed at this time.
ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMN.Message: Cannot clear the controller configuration metadata on physical drives at this time

ClearConfigurationClearPhysicalDriveCCMU.Description: Indicates that the controller configuration metadata on physical drives cannot be cleared for an unknown reason.

ReturnToFactoryNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that reseting the controller to factory settings is not allowed at this time.
ReturnToFactoryNotAllowed.Message: Cannot reset the controller to factory defaults at this time

CanErasePhysicalDriveNotUnassigned.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be erased because it is not unassigned.
CanErasePhysicalDriveNotUnassigned.Message: Cannot erase physical drive %1 because the drive is not unassigned

CanErasePhysicalDriveIsHBA.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be erased because the drive is exposed to the operating system.

CanErasePhysicalDriveIsFailed.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be erased because the drive is failed.
CanErasePhysicalDriveIsFailed.Message: Cannot erase physical drive %1 because the drive is failed
CanErasePhysicalDriveIsFailed.Resolution: Check the state of the drive.

CanErasePhysicalDrivePatternNotSupported.Description: Indicates that the desired erase pattern is not supported on the target drive.
CanErasePhysicalDrivePatternNotSupported.Message: Cannot erase physical drive %1 because the drive does not support the desired erase pattern

CanErasePhysicalDriveIsErasing.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be erased because the drive is currently erasing.
CanErasePhysicalDriveIsErasing.Message: Cannot erase physical drive %1 because the drive is currently erasing
CanErasePhysicalDriveIsErasing.Resolution: Wait for the physical drive erase to complete.

CanErasePhysicalDriveNotAllowed.Description: Indicates that the physical drive erase is not allowed at this time.
CanErasePhysicalDriveNotAllowed.Message: Cannot erase physical drives at this time

CanErasePhysicalDriveSanitizeLockFreeze.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be sanitized because the sanitize lock is set to freeze.
CanErasePhysicalDriveSanitizeLockFreeze.Message: Cannot sanitize physical drive %1 because the controller sanitize lock is set to freeze

CanErasePhysicalDriveUnknownError.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be erased for an unknown reason.

ErasePhysicalDriveNotFound.Description: Indicates that the physical drive requested for erase was not found.
ErasePhysicalDriveNotFound.Message: Erase not started on physical drive %1 because it is not found

ErasePhysicalDriveFailed.Description: Indicates that the physical drive was not erased due to an unknown error.
ErasePhysicalDriveFailed.Message: Physical drive %1 not erased due to an unknown error

CanStopErasePhysicalDriveNotErasing.Description: Indicates that the physical drive was not enabled because it is not erasing.
CanStopErasePhysicalDriveNotErasing.Message: Physical drive %1 not enabled because drive is not erasing

CanStopErasePhysicalDriveSanitizing.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be enabled because it is currently sanitizing.
CanStopErasePhysicalDriveSanitizing.Message: Physical drive %1 was not enabled because it is currently undergoing a sanitize erase
CanStopErasePhysicalDriveSanitizing.Resolution: Resubmit the request at a later time.

CanEnableErasedPhysicalDriveRestrictedSa.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be enabled because of a restricted, failed sanitize erase.
CanEnableErasedPhysicalDriveRestrictedSa.Message: Physical drive %1 was not enabled because it is currently in a restricted, failed sanitize state
CanEnableErasedPhysicalDriveRestrictedSa.Resolution: Restart the sanitize erase on the physical drive.

CanStopEnableErasedPhysicalDriveUnknownE.Description: Indicates that the physical drive cannot be enabled for an unknown reason.

EnablePhysicalDriveNotFound.Description: Indicates that the physical drive requested to be enabled was not found.
EnablePhysicalDriveNotFound.Message: Physical drive %1 was not enabled because it is not found

EnablePhysicalDriveFailed.Description: Indicates that the physical drive was not enabled due to an unknown error.
EnablePhysicalDriveFailed.Message: Physical drive %1 not enabled due to an unknown error

RebootRequired.Description: Indicates that a reboot is required to apply the configuration.
RebootRequired.Message: Reboot is required to apply the configuration
RebootRequired.Resolution: Reboot the system to apply the configuration.

RebootAndRetryRequired.Description: Indicates that a reboot is required then reapply the configuration.
RebootAndRetryRequired.Message: Reboot is required then reapply the configuration
RebootAndRetryRequired.Resolution: Reboot the system then reapply the configuration.
